Text.valUnicode: {\rtf1\fbidis\ansi\ansicpg1252\deff0\deflang1033{\fonttbl{\f0\fnil\fcharset0 Microsoft Sans Serif;}} {\colortbl ;\red0\green0\blue0;\red255\green0\blue128;} {\*\generator Msftedit 5.41.21.2510;}\viewkind4\uc1\pard\ltrpar\cf1\b\f0\fs20 There are several events that can be used to mark records quickly. Most of these are set to keyboard shortcuts, but you can also raise them internally. Both methods are used in this example.\par \par In this example, you can experiment with marking records in a table, using the shortcut keys:\par \par Invert Marking:\cf2 \cf1 No Setting\par Mark To Top: No Setting\cf2\par \cf1 Mark To Bottom: No Setting\par Mark\\Unmark: \cf2 Ctrl+Space\cf1\par }

Text.val: Here we process the selected records.
Reset the selected fields. This only executes once, as the last record is processed.
